body:
## Bevy Version
`main` branch

## Example Reference

https://github.com/bevyengine/bevy/blob/main/examples/ui/text.rs

## Description

I was going through the examples today to update one of my plugins for Bevy 0.15 and the naming of the structs in the `ui/text.rs` example caused me to do a double take. There's a marker struct named `ColorText` that's used to query for the text component that it wants to change the color of. This is very similar in name to the `TextColor` Bevy component for setting the color of the text and is used in this example:

```rust
fn text_color_system(time: Res<Time>, mut query: Query<&mut TextColor, With<ColorText>>) 
```

While there is a comment in this example that describes `ColorText`, I think it would make more sense, especially to new Bevy users who are referencing this example to build their first app, if we use a more descriptive and distinct name for this struct. Perhaps something like `ColorChangingText` or even `TextWeWantToChangeTheColorOf` if we wanted it be as plain as possible.

Unrelated to the primary purpose of this issue, but related to this example, the comments that describe the structs use the term `unit struct`, which is something I haven't seen used before. AFAIK in other Bevy documentation and external resources, these kinds of structs are described as `markers`. I'm not totally clear on the distinction but if they mean the same thing, perhaps we should be consistent.
